basics.name: Andrea Murillo Martinez
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Electrical Engineering in the Electrophysiscs Track at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2026.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI

work.summary: Monitor and facilitate lab equipment to students
highlights: Supervise and help students use 3D printers, SolidWorks, laser cut machine, soldering, etc.
Create video tutorials for lab equipment.
Developed a python app for a seamless integration between Data Drive, SQL databases, and FTP servers, reducing manual effort and increasing data accuracy.
Automated wafer pickmap retrieval and transfer by navigating Data Drive directories and efficiently uploading files to OSAT FTP servers or local storage, streamlining data management workflows.

Enhanced operational productivity by implementing new features such as error-handling mechanisms, data validation processes, and optimized file transfer protocols, reducing production time and minimizing human error.

volunteer.organization: Center for Renewable Energy and Island Sustainability
volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
